musicalLanguage.description: Cuba's most famous folk song, built on a simple three-chord pattern in C major. The melody is instantly recognizable and singable, making this an ideal beginner piece. The left hand plays a basic Latin accompaniment pattern while the right hand carries the beloved melody. The simplicity is its strength.
musicalLanguage.structure: Verse: C-F-G-C pattern (4 bars), Chorus: same chords with melodic variation (4 bars)
keyMoments: Bar 1: C major — the opening call. Everyone knows this melody.
Bars 3-4: G to C — the singalong resolution that makes crowds join in.
Bars 5-6: The chorus melody lifts higher — more energy, same simplicity.
teachingGoals: Three-chord song in C major — I, IV, V
Playing a melody that everyone can sing along to
styleTips: Warm and communal — this is a song for everyone to share
Keep the rhythm steady and danceable
Left hand should have a gentle Cuban feel — not too rigid

measures.teachingNote: C major — the famous opening. Simple and warm.
F major — melody peaks on A then settles. Natural and easy.
G major — setting up the return. Melody rocks gently.
C major — home. Two half notes. Clean and satisfying.
Chorus — C major, melody lifts to the higher octave.
F major — descending melody. The sing-along peak.
G major — preparing final resolution. Keep singing inside.
C major — whole note ending. Arpeggio in the bass for a warm finish.
